name: Holiday Inn Buffalo Downtown

reviews.text: Taking our 8-month old daughter for an overnight stay away from home for the first time. Originally wanted to get into the Double Tree closed by, and was hoping the hotwire roulette would land me there, because of the kitchenette more than anything. Got this hotel instead, read the reviews, and was kinda worried.
reviews.title: Exceeded my (lowered) expectation

reviews.text: It turned out fine, particularly in areas I was worried about after reading the other reviews. The decor looked dated but every was clean; the mattress was fine with soft pillows; the front desk attendants were friendly and nice to talk to.
reviews.title: Could do with a make over

reviews.text: A few negatives: Reserved a mini-fridge which wasn't in the room when we checked in (I ordered a crib too which was there when we arrived), and we had to call front desk twice over 45 minutes before it showed up. The sound proofing can also use some work: Hallway noise was very audible.
reviews.title: I was very surprised

likes.liked: — The evening manager called to check with me

reviews.text: I was in Buffalo on personal business for two days and was referred to the Holiday Inn by locals. Although a convenient location to get to and to where I needed to be and also to see the Niagara Falls attractions and the price wasn’t bad, the room AC was outdated and ran either too hot or too cold. It was very warm and humid during our stay. The bathroom was in rough condition with broken tiles and general overall unclean feeling and smell. The linens and towels were clean and room was modern looking however with the poor AC, the room always had a sticky feeling too it. Gave me the overwhelming sense it wasn’t very well cleaned.
reviews.title: A place to rest your head...

likes.disliked: — Dated AC systems, cleanliness of bathroom, no lunch!

reviews.text: We ordered rooms service for breakfast which was prompt and average food you’d get at an IHOP or Denny’s. Room service was limited....No lunch. I don’t even think the restaurant was open for lunch. The surrounding neighborhood seemed to be transitional so it didn’t appear to be the safest area to stroll after 9pm. We did find a place to eat lunch which was very good…just across the street and around the corner on Allen Street. There was a Walgreen’s right next door which was helpful if you forgot something.
reviews.title: Don't plan on sleeping

reviews.text: There were a couple problems with our bill. When we checked in there was no bottled water in the room. Apparently there should have been and we were charged for the bottled water. Also we ordered a movie but inadvertently hit the next channel button (instead of volume) when we just started the movie– which cancels out you movie order and you have to reorder! Which I find simply ridiculous….there was a warning about that but it’s the first time I’ve seen that at hotel…typically you can change channels and go back to your movie.
reviews.title: Holiday Surprise

likes.disliked: — I did not get to stay longer, my trip was too short!

reviews.text: The front desk credited both at check out. All the staff were extremely helpful, willing to please, and very friendly. Everyone we met in the Buffalo area were very nice and frinedly unlike grumpy Boston. I look forward to visiting friendly Buffalo again but perhaps not staying at the Holiday Inn.
reviews.title: A above average Holiday Inn

likes.liked: — The very helpful front desk staff
likes.disliked: — The lounge ran out of some drinks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stay in hotels about 200 nights every year. This hotel has to be the loudest of any of them. I was there twice in two weeks and got no sleep either time. I realize the hotel can't control other guests, but both times, I had doors slamming constantly through the night. The hotel doesn't seem to have anything on the doors to slow them down when someone shuts them, or any sort of of buffer between the door and the frame, like rubber shock pads. When someone shuts the door, it closes fast, and its metal against metal.
reviews.title: Best Place to stay on a budget

aka: Holiday Inn Buffalo Downtown Hotel Buffalo
description: Welcome to the Holiday Inn Buffalo Downtown. We are located in the historic Allentown district of Buffalo and near quaint shops, restaurants and attractions. The hotel is a city high-rise with 167 rooms, and renovated meeting and banquet facilities. We offer a seasonal outdoor heated pool and a fitness center. Be sure to stop by our award winning restaurant, Grille 620.Take in the many historical sights of Buffalo while staying at the Holiday Inn Buffalo Downtown. Located adjacent to the Wilcox Mansion, site of the Teddy Roosevelt inauguration and just a few minutes from Frank Lloyd Wrights Darwin Martin House. While staying with us, take in a show at Sheas Performing Arts Center, the Irish Classical Theatre or enjoy a little Shakespeare in Delaware Park. Art lovers will be thrilled to visit the Albright Knox Art Gallery and the Burchfield Penny Art Center located minutes away at Buffalo State College.Come and stay with us for the annual Allentown Arts Festival; the event is held right outside our doors! State and federal office building are less than 4 miles away, and we are approximately 5 minutes to the New York/Canadian border.
